content: वृत्त {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} [वृत्-कर्तरि-क्त] {@--1@} Lived, existed. {@--2@} Occurred, happened. {@--3@} Completed, finished. {@--4@} Performed, done, acted. {@--5@} Past, gone. {@--6@} Round, circular; <ls>R. 6. 32.</ls> {@--7@} Dead, deceased. {@--8@} Firm, fixed. {@--9@} Read through, studied. {@--10@} Derived from. {@--11@} Famous. {@--12@} Covered. {@--13@} Turned. (See वृत्). --त्तः A tortoise. --त्तं {@--1@} An event, occurrence. {@--2@} History, account; <ls>R. 15. 64.</ls> {@--3@} News, tidings. {@--4@} Practice, profession, mode of life, occupation; सतां वृत्तमनुष्ठिताः <ls>Ms. 10. 127</ls> <ab>v. l.</ab>, <ls n="Ms.">7. 122</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 44.</ls> {@--5@} Conduct, behaviour, manner, act, action; as in सद्वृत्त, दुर्वृत्त. {@--6@} Good or virtuous conduct; <ls>Pt. 4. 28.</ls> {@--7@} An established rule or usage, law, custom; observance of such rule or usage, duty; <ls>R. 5. 33.</ls> {@--8@} A circle, circumference of a circle. {@--9@} A metre in general, especially a metre regulated by the number of syllables it contains (<ab>opp.</ab> जाति); see App. I.
